GOD.content: interpretations, reading, tradition of Isaac’s sacrifice have become sites of holocaustic sacrifice
GOD.linkedContent: interpretations, reading, tradition of Isaac’s sacrifice have become sites of holocaustic sacrifice

GOD.content: machines of death that wage a war w/ no front
GOD.linkedContent: machines of death that wage a war w/ no front

GT.content: text [“Counterfeit Money”]: a machine for provoking events

MONL.content: people must yield to the homo-hegemony of dominant languages, the languages of masters, capital, machine
MONL.linkedContent: people must yield to the homo-hegemony of dominant languages, the languages of masters, capital, machine

R.content: turning of the question, double question, question of question, like being locked in a circular machine that does not work or turn just right [Olivia]
R.linkedContent: turning of the question, double question, question of question, like being locked in a circular machine that does not work or turn just right [Olivia]

R.content: no justice, neither political nor ethical, when following calculated law like automatic machine
R.linkedContent: no justice, neither political nor ethical, when following calculated law like automatic machine

FK.content: evil as the deracination of the abstract > lead to machine, tele-technology, cyberspace
FK.linkedContent: evil as the deracination of the abstract > lead to machine, tele-technology, cyberspace

FK.content: machine-like spontaneity (sponta sua, what flows from the source) [event has machine-like properties], “religion” begins again, quasi-automatically
FK.linkedContent: machine-like spontaneity (sponta sua, what flows from the source) [event has machine-like properties], “religion” begins again, quasi-automatically

FK.content: descent of God ex machina, stage a “transcendental addressing machine”
FK.linkedContent: descent of God ex machina, stage a “transcendental addressing machine”

FK.content: temptation of knowledge: to believe not only in what one knows one knows but to know, have faith, in what knowledge is
FK.linkedContent: temptation of knowledge: to believe not only in what one knows one knows but to know, have faith, in what knowledge is

FK.content: the scholar’s (Benveniste’s) scruple, assurance and also hesitation, between the proper meaning and its other > quasi-automatic, machine-like, also religious: restraint of response
FK.linkedContent: the scholar’s (Benveniste’s) scruple, assurance and also hesitation, between the proper meaning and its other > quasi-automatic, machine-like, also religious: restraint of response

FK.content: quasi-spontaneous automaticity: confused identity, auto-immunity, auto-indemnify > detaches & reattaches (to family, proper) at same time, mystical or secret mechanicity: unheimlich
FK.linkedContent: quasi-spontaneous automaticity: confused identity, auto-immunity, auto-indemnify > detaches & reattaches (to family, proper) at same time, mystical or secret mechanicity: unheimlich

FK.content: machine (technē) & sacrosanct: one and same possibility

technical, automatic, machine-like [the possibility of faith, its very chance], a chance that entails risk of radical evil, otherwise it would simply be pure know-how, pure knowledge, annulment of future, programme, proof, predictability, providence
FK.linkedContent: technical, automatic, machine-like [the possibility of faith, its very chance], a chance that entails risk of radical evil, otherwise it would simply be pure know-how, pure knowledge, annulment of future, programme, proof, predictability, providence

FK.content: machine-like & faith as one and the same possibility, machine-like & sacrosanctity (heilig, holy, safe, unscathed, free, “swollen”) of the phallic effect: phallus as phainesthai, phenomenon (day of phallus) & also phantasm, fetish, specter, its double: colossal automaticity [phallic in bold 2x]
FK.linkedContent: machine-like & faith as one and the same possibility, machine-like & sacrosanctity (heilig, holy, safe, unscathed, free, “swollen”) of the phallic effect: phallus as phainesthai, phenomenon (day of phallus) & also phantasm, fetish, specter, its double: colossal automaticity [phallic in bold 2x]

FK.content: machine, mechanics, reproduces the dead in the living; the marionette, the dead machine, automation acc. phallic effect
FK.linkedContent: machine, mechanics, reproduces the dead in the living; the marionette, the dead machine, automation acc. phallic effect

FK.content: in view of invisible, spectral sur-vival, an excess beyond living, life worth more than life, space of death opens—linked to automaton (exemplarily “phallic”), to technics, machine, prosthesis
FK.linkedContent: in view of invisible, spectral sur-vival, an excess beyond living, life worth more than life, space of death opens—linked to automaton (exemplarily “phallic”), to technics, machine, prosthesis

FK.content: religious bond btwn value of life, its absolute “dignity,” and the theological machine, the “machine for making gods” [Bergson]
FK.linkedContent: religious bond btwn value of life, its absolute “dignity,” and the theological machine, the “machine for making gods” [Bergson]

FL.content: judge—calculating machine, decision to calculate is not of the order of the calculable
FL.linkedContent: judge—calculating machine, decision to calculate is not of the order of the calculable

AF.content: Freud’s Mystic Pad still participates in Cartesian space [FSW pp. 227-28] > do new archival machines (ones Freud could never dreamed of) change anything?
AF.linkedContent: Freud’s Mystic Pad still participates in Cartesian space [FSW pp. 227-28] > do new archival machines (ones Freud could never dreamed of) change anything?

AF.content: archival technē overflows singularity of event, i.e. the answering machine that outlives its moment of recording, the ghost speaks
AF.linkedContent: archival technē overflows singularity of event, i.e. the answering machine that outlives its moment of recording, the ghost speaks

SPOM.content: for Marx, capital contradiction, contradiction of automatic autonomy: 1) inert thing [table] appears inspired, has pneuma or psychē 2) remains caught in heavy thingness of hulē
SPOM.linkedContent: for Marx, capital contradiction, contradiction of automatic autonomy: 1) inert thing [table] appears inspired, has pneuma or psychē 2) remains caught in heavy thingness of hulē

SPOM.content: autonomy the mask of automatism, visor hides absence of living gaze, automaton mimes the living, Thing neither dead nor alive, it survives, war machine, theatrical machine, mekhanē
SPOM.linkedContent: autonomy the mask of automatism, visor hides absence of living gaze, automaton mimes the living, Thing neither dead nor alive, it survives, war machine, theatrical machine, mekhanē

SEC.content: history of writing conform to law of mechanical economy: gain most space & time by means of most convenient abbreviation
SEC.linkedContent: history of writing conform to law of mechanical economy: gain most space & time by means of most convenient abbreviation

SEC.content: to write is to produce a mark that is a kind of machine, legible in scribe’s absence (this drifting of absolute responsibility, this orphaned writing > what Plato condemns in Phaedrus)
SEC.linkedContent: to write is to produce a mark that is a kind of machine, legible in scribe’s absence (this drifting of absolute responsibility, this orphaned writing > what Plato condemns in Phaedrus)

OH.content: Valéry: Mediterranean has been a veritable machine for making culture
OH.linkedContent: Valéry: Mediterranean has been a veritable machine for making culture

PAS.content: a debt that annuls itself in being infinite > Derrida's debt to Blanchot’s machination sans machine, which is what interests him, what fascinates him, as does fascination
PAS.linkedContent: a debt that annuls itself in being infinite > Derrida's debt to Blanchot’s machination sans machine, which is what interests him, what fascinates him, as does fascination

PPHS.content: classical take on writing as “practical exterior activity,” as that which “comes to the aid” condemns all mnemotechniques, all langue machines, all supplementary repetitions > life of spirit is thusly forced to emerge from its interior
PPHS.linkedContent: classical take on writing as “practical exterior activity,” as that which “comes to the aid” condemns all mnemotechniques, all langue machines, all supplementary repetitions > life of spirit is thusly forced to emerge from its interior

PPHS.content: for Hegel, machine works as a negation w/out relève, thus Hegel could never think a machine that could work! that which doesn’t work in service of meaning: pure loss
PPHS.linkedContent: for Hegel, machine works as a negation w/out relève, thus Hegel could never think a machine that could work! that which doesn’t work in service of meaning: pure loss

PPHS.content: but Derrida sees machine working by itself, outside > Hegel’s logic, syntax, concepts, engaged in system of this unpower [of course, not enough to “essentialize” technology]
PPHS.linkedContent: but Derrida sees machine working by itself, outside > Hegel’s logic, syntax, concepts, engaged in system of this unpower [of course, not enough to “essentialize” technology]

PPHS.content: [Hegel on calculation and machine] a “living,” “thinking,” “speaking” protest against repetition
PPHS.linkedContent: [Hegel on calculation and machine] a “living,” “thinking,” “speaking” protest against repetition

T.content: Marges concerns relevance of limit, a reading of the Hegelian Aufhebung, a reading beyond Hegel’s own intention, beyond that which is inscribed on the internal vestibule of his ear, where Hegel’s text would be a writing machine of “conscious intention,” thus a mechanical reader
T.linkedContent: Marges concerns relevance of limit, a reading of the Hegelian Aufhebung, a reading beyond Hegel’s own intention, beyond that which is inscribed on the internal vestibule of his ear, where Hegel’s text would be a writing machine of “conscious intention,” thus a mechanical reader

T.content: as long as the tympanum of philosophical mastery is not destroyed, all liberties (denegation, precipitation, ignorance, or stupidity) one takes w/ philosophical order will remain activated a tergo by misconstrued philosophical machines > called back to order
T.linkedContent: as long as the tympanum of philosophical mastery is not destroyed, all liberties (denegation, precipitation, ignorance, or stupidity) one takes w/ philosophical order will remain activated a tergo by misconstrued philosophical machines > called back to order

T.content: pp. leiris xxiv-xxv [song as margin—ineffable and machinery]
T.linkedContent: pp. leiris xxiv-xxv [song as margin—ineffable and machinery]

T.content: like w/ Mystic Pad, question of writing machine should upset (devrait fair basculer) space of proper body dans l’entraînement sans limite des machines de machines et donc de machines à main coupée ——question of machine one more time, btwn pit & pyramid, in the margins (of Hegelian text)
T.linkedContent: like w/ Mystic Pad, question of writing machine should upset (devrait fair basculer) space of proper body dans l’entraînement sans limite des machines de machines et donc de machines à main coupée ——question of machine one more time, btwn pit & pyramid, in the margins (of Hegelian text)

F.content: machinery of words, calculating shrewdness, mêkhanê, theater of words, autonomization of language > in The Magic Word who holds the dictionaries?
F.linkedContent: machinery of words, calculating shrewdness, mêkhanê, theater of words, autonomization of language > in The Magic Word who holds the dictionaries?

F.content: machinery would attest to existence of crypt
F.linkedContent: machinery would attest to existence of crypt

FWT.content: most “free” thought always coming to terms w/ effects machine; deconstruction thinks hypercomplexity, historicity, of machine (along w/ event) better than scientific positivists
FWT.linkedContent: most “free” thought always coming to terms w/ effects machine; deconstruction thinks hypercomplexity, historicity, of machine (along w/ event) better than scientific positivists

FWT.content: where calculation reaches its limit: play, possibility of play w/in calculating machines > arrival of other produces effects in machine, but can’t be calculated by them > we shouldn’t close our eyes to extraordinary progress of calculation, to the machine, while still giving over to exposure to, play of, the other > invent discourse capable of taking this into account
FWT.linkedContent: where calculation reaches its limit: play, possibility of play w/in calculating machines > arrival of other produces effects in machine, but can’t be calculated by them > we shouldn’t close our eyes to extraordinary progress of calculation, to the machine, while still giving over to exposure to, play of, the other > invent discourse capable of taking this into account

FWT.content: affect: relation of living being to other, incalculable, foreign to all machines
FWT.linkedContent: affect: relation of living being to other, incalculable, foreign to all machines

POOF.content: if Montaigne’s disproportion of sovereign friendship is translated into the political, wouldn’t that endanger Aristotle’s principle of autarky, equality, mutuality [?] > but our question is always about political translation: is the political a universal translating machine?
POOF.linkedContent: if Montaigne’s disproportion of sovereign friendship is translated into the political, wouldn’t that endanger Aristotle’s principle of autarky, equality, mutuality [?] > but our question is always about political translation: is the political a universal translating machine?

DS.content: [Derrida describes six-pronged scheme re: tradition of mimesis, which have produced, like a machine, all clichés and criticisms on the topic]
DS.linkedContent: [Derrida describes six-pronged scheme re: tradition of mimesis, which have produced, like a machine, all clichés and criticisms on the topic]

DS.content: chain “fiction,” “hymen,” “spacious,” gets caught in, while disrupting, ontological machine (dislocating oppositions)
“re-presentation” [Derrida via Mallarmé]: less concerned with setting forth things, the image of things, than setting up a machine > repetition-toward-itself of text as re-folding
DS.linkedContent: “re-presentation” [Derrida via Mallarmé]: less concerned with setting forth things, the image of things, than setting up a machine > repetition-toward-itself of text as re-folding

OTO.content: how can reactive degeneration [Nazism] exploit same utterances, rallying cries, of active forces [Übermensch]—nor did this specular ruse elude Nietzsche: is there a “programming machine”? marrying the 2 forces (family resemblances) in a set, as life (does) death? but no regional power could set limit on such a set > no ordinary “machine,” there’s “life” in it > plays w/ opposition life/death > is there a practical rewriting of the program, which would no longer be part of it? if so, would not be produced in books
OTO.linkedContent: how can reactive degeneration [Nazism] exploit same utterances, rallying cries, of active forces [Übermensch]—nor did this specular ruse elude Nietzsche: is there a “programming machine”? marrying the 2 forces (family resemblances) in a set, as life (does) death? but no regional power could set limit on such a set > no ordinary “machine,” there’s “life” in it > plays w/ opposition life/death > is there a practical rewriting of the program, which would no longer be part of it? if so, would not be produced in books

ATIA.content: Kant’s animal “als ein Maschinen der Vorsehung” (a providential machine), blind but sure prefiguration
ATIA.linkedContent: Kant’s animal “als ein Maschinen der Vorsehung” (a providential machine), blind but sure prefiguration

ATIA.content: Heidegger’s animal-machine, crossing-out, a figure of evil, resembles the virus that obsesses “everything I write,” quasi-animal, knows how to erase traces
ATIA.linkedContent: Heidegger’s animal-machine, crossing-out, a figure of evil, resembles the virus that obsesses “everything I write,” quasi-animal, knows how to erase traces

ATIA.content: reinterpretation of animal calls for another concept of machine, of semiotic machine > of cybernetics, artificial intelligence, zoo-, bio- engineering, the genic in general
ATIA.linkedContent: reinterpretation of animal calls for another concept of machine, of semiotic machine > of cybernetics, artificial intelligence, zoo-, bio- engineering, the genic in general

ATIA.content: Descartes: we should not confuse speech w/ machines (animals) that can imitate it
ATIA.linkedContent: Descartes: we should not confuse speech w/ machines (animals) that can imitate it

ATIA.content: for Kant, a deus ex machina, a Maschinenwesen der Vorsehung (providential machine) regularizes course of history > man’s war is purposeful, has Triebfeder, unlike animal “war”
ATIA.linkedContent: for Kant, a deus ex machina, a Maschinenwesen der Vorsehung (providential machine) regularizes course of history > man’s war is purposeful, has Triebfeder, unlike animal “war”

ATIA.content: unthought, unconscious, other of the “I think,” (the animal je suis), a function of machinality > haunts automatically, like an evil genius, the Cartesian animal-machine & Kant’s teleological, providential-machine (where war machines presumed to have civilizing effect)
ATIA.linkedContent: unthought, unconscious, other of the “I think,” (the animal je suis), a function of machinality > haunts automatically, like an evil genius, the Cartesian animal-machine & Kant’s teleological, providential-machine (where war machines presumed to have civilizing effect)

ATIA.content: [3 machines?]: animal-machine, teleogizing war-machine, and machine of other
ATIA.linkedContent: [3 machines?]: animal-machine, teleogizing war-machine, and machine of other

ATIA.content: all thinkers who demand response to be human don’t think iterability essential to every response: which adds an automatic, mechanical reaction to the most alive, authentic, responsible
ATIA.linkedContent: all thinkers who demand response to be human don’t think iterability essential to every response: which adds an automatic, mechanical reaction to the most alive, authentic, responsible

ATIA.content: for Heidegger, animal lives don’t exist, must strike out (Durchstreichung) all words when speaking about what appears to the animal, nothing appears “as such” [but, might the animal itself, the animal-machine, put into effect all these necessary ratures?]
ATIA.linkedContent: for Heidegger, animal lives don’t exist, must strike out (Durchstreichung) all words when speaking about what appears to the animal, nothing appears “as such” [but, might the animal itself, the animal-machine, put into effect all these necessary ratures?]

O.content: for Hegel, preface has some affinity w/ math: a machine devoid of meaning or life
O.linkedContent: for Hegel, preface has some affinity w/ math: a machine devoid of meaning or life

O.content: excess of writing not improv., throw of dice does not contradict rigorous necessity of “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus)
O.linkedContent: excess of writing not improv., throw of dice does not contradict rigorous necessity of “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus)

WAP.content: somewhat Foucault-like vision of network of programs as profound machine, though the additional idea that this machine reinvests, reemploys, itself in each determined configuration
WAP.linkedContent: somewhat Foucault-like vision of network of programs as profound machine, though the additional idea that this machine reinvests, reemploys, itself in each determined configuration

WAP.content: [when quasi-systematic deconstruction differs from Foucault: no empirical light-headedness]
WAP.linkedContent: [when quasi-systematic deconstruction differs from Foucault: no empirical light-headedness]

WAP.content: deconstruction must not choose btwn long, barely mobile networks & short, quickly outdated ones > must display strange logic: multiple powers of oldest machine can always be reinvested/exploited in new situation
WAP.linkedContent: deconstruction must not choose btwn long, barely mobile networks & short, quickly outdated ones > must display strange logic: multiple powers of oldest machine can always be reinvested/exploited in new situation

DPi.content: DP requires a third party, arbitrating authority foreign/superior to parties of dispute, a reason of state, a rationality, logos w/ universal claims > beyond individual passion/affect
DPi.linkedContent: DP requires a third party, arbitrating authority foreign/superior to parties of dispute, a reason of state, a rationality, logos w/ universal claims > beyond individual passion/affect

DPi.content: w/ DP, rationality rises above heart (individual passion), alliance btwn reason & machine, universal claim of state right, frozen rigor, rigor mortis, “freezing insensitivity,” police-like, virile appearance > thus, many abolitionists appeal to feminine, heart, immediate feeling
DPi.linkedContent: w/ DP, rationality rises above heart (individual passion), alliance btwn reason & machine, universal claim of state right, frozen rigor, rigor mortis, “freezing insensitivity,” police-like, virile appearance > thus, many abolitionists appeal to feminine, heart, immediate feeling

DPi.content: memory/archivization engage suffering body in a machine, technical repetition, Mnemoteknik, must cause suffering, red of fire before red of blood > for N., punishment is not juridical: it’s a movement of life, writing to remember, inscription, imprint past in body
DPi.linkedContent: memory/archivization engage suffering body in a machine, technical repetition, Mnemoteknik, must cause suffering, red of fire before red of blood > for N., punishment is not juridical: it’s a movement of life, writing to remember, inscription, imprint past in body

DPi.content: guillotine made feminine to rhyme w/ machine

Enlightenment concepts of guillotine not in contradiction w/ certain Christian humanism: the dignified, humanistic death; it is progressive: 1) egalitarian 2) individualist 3) mechanistic, machinisitic > only the machine can make everyone equal before the law
DPi.linkedContent: Enlightenment concepts of guillotine not in contradiction w/ certain Christian humanism: the dignified, humanistic death; it is progressive: 1) egalitarian 2) individualist 3) mechanistic, machinisitic > only the machine can make everyone equal before the law

Gi.content: Derrida wonders about a reading machine (one must think of programming the machine & know how to do it) that would snare (gibier), hunt down, sexual difference in Heidegger
Gi.linkedContent: Derrida wonders about a reading machine (one must think of programming the machine & know how to do it) that would snare (gibier), hunt down, sexual difference in Heidegger

Gii.content: Derrida proposes “manuscripture" to Heidegger’s handwriting (Handschrift), given that typewriting, which Heidegger will indict, is also a handwriting
Gii.linkedContent: Derrida proposes “manuscripture" to Heidegger’s handwriting (Handschrift), given that typewriting, which Heidegger will indict, is also a handwriting

Gii.content: Heidegger: typewriter “tears (entreisst) writing from the essential realm of the hand” [MOP]
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger: typewriter “tears (entreisst) writing from the essential realm of the hand” [MOP]

Gii.content: machine “degrades” word into means of commerce, offers the advantage, for those who enjoy degradation, of dissimulation > Heidegger: “typewriter makes everyone look the same”
Gii.linkedContent: machine “degrades” word into means of commerce, offers the advantage, for those who enjoy degradation, of dissimulation > Heidegger: “typewriter makes everyone look the same”

Gii.content: typewriter becomes signless, a-signifying (zeichenlos), it dissimulates, a movement of withdrawal, subtraction (entziehen) [loses the hand]
Gii.linkedContent: typewriter becomes signless, a-signifying (zeichenlos), it dissimulates, a movement of withdrawal, subtraction (entziehen) [loses the hand]

TR.content: mēkhanē: theatrical/war machine, something both mechanical & strategic
for Rousseau, work of evil, “wickedness of men,” must be trade secret of God, can’t accuse mēkhanē (strategy, machine) of men (but can’t accuse God—so must put blind trust in him)
TR.linkedContent: for Rousseau, work of evil, “wickedness of men,” must be trade secret of God, can’t accuse mēkhanē (strategy, machine) of men (but can’t accuse God—so must put blind trust in him)

TR.content: the 2 meanings of arriver: 1) event that happens to someone 2) message that arrives—or doesn’t arrive at destination, or at some unforeseeable addressee > this singular instability plays w/ its own automatism, never spontaneously interrupted [?] [privileged access to machine effect]
TR.linkedContent: the 2 meanings of arriver: 1) event that happens to someone 2) message that arrives—or doesn’t arrive at destination, or at some unforeseeable addressee > this singular instability plays w/ its own automatism, never spontaneously interrupted [?] [privileged access to machine effect]

TR.content: concept of “machine” indissociable from deconstruction: “a text whose grammaticality is a logical code obeys a machine” > no text w/out grammar, w/out machine, w/out “suspension of referential meaning”
TR.linkedContent: concept of “machine” indissociable from deconstruction: “a text whose grammaticality is a logical code obeys a machine” > no text w/out grammar, w/out machine, w/out “suspension of referential meaning”

TR.content: formidable effects of machinelike automaticity: an a priori, programmed “I apologize” > automatic forgiveness self-destructs w/out delay (faster than “Mission Impossible” tapes), loses its meaning, its memory, annihilates its own archive
TR.linkedContent: formidable effects of machinelike automaticity: an a priori, programmed “I apologize” > automatic forgiveness self-destructs w/out delay (faster than “Mission Impossible” tapes), loses its meaning, its memory, annihilates its own archive

TR.content: what is terrifying: what cuts me off from my own initiative [?] > automaticity discuplates & threatens “me”—quasi-excuses, ghosts of excuses, quasi-faults, spectral silhouettes of pardons: “as if” of this quasi, limitless risk of becoming simulacrum, virtuality
TR.linkedContent: what is terrifying: what cuts me off from my own initiative [?] > automaticity discuplates & threatens “me”—quasi-excuses, ghosts of excuses, quasi-faults, spectral silhouettes of pardons: “as if” of this quasi, limitless risk of becoming simulacrum, virtuality

TR.content: machineness (machinalité): materiality that’s not necessarily a corporeality, programming, repetition, iterability, technicity (cutting off from living subject)
TR.linkedContent: machineness (machinalité): materiality that’s not necessarily a corporeality, programming, repetition, iterability, technicity (cutting off from living subject)

TR.content: via Rousseau, as if one always had to excuse oneself for failing to do so: and once one does, one is excused in advance or condemned forever > madness of this machine (interests us)
TR.linkedContent: via Rousseau, as if one always had to excuse oneself for failing to do so: and once one does, one is excused in advance or condemned forever > madness of this machine (interests us)

TR.content: notion of grammar understood acc. trivium/quadrivium (see Warminski), but also as a machine of the letter (gramma), letter machine, writing machine
TR.linkedContent: notion of grammar understood acc. trivium/quadrivium (see Warminski), but also as a machine of the letter (gramma), letter machine, writing machine

TR.content: machine determined by grammar and vice versa
TR.linkedContent: machine determined by grammar and vice versa

PJP.content: Christian marriage a machine of death: give oneself death as one pretends to be giving oneself life, to life, life to one’s children > ***Christianity marries everything
PJP.linkedContent: Christian marriage a machine of death: give oneself death as one pretends to be giving oneself life, to life, life to one’s children > ***Christianity marries everything

D.content: no one can enter Soller’s Numbers who thinks literature/thought ought to exorcise the machine (that the 2 have nothing to do w/ each other)
D.linkedContent: no one can enter Soller’s Numbers who thinks literature/thought ought to exorcise the machine (that the 2 have nothing to do w/ each other)

D.content: every term depends on place [in?] machine—entrained into an ordered series of cuts
D.linkedContent: every term depends on place [in?] machine—entrained into an ordered series of cuts

D.content: re: Soller’s Numbers, Plato’s cave contained in an incommensurably, imprévisiblement, more complicated machine
D.linkedContent: re: Soller’s Numbers, Plato’s cave contained in an incommensurably, imprévisiblement, more complicated machine

D.content: because innumerable beyond/short of what can be read by machine: excess & lack (defect)
D.linkedContent: because innumerable beyond/short of what can be read by machine: excess & lack (defect)

HST.content: Levinas: tools suppress intermediary times, contract duration, machines sum up instants, produce speed, echo impatience of desire [modern tools are machines]
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: tools suppress intermediary times, contract duration, machines sum up instants, produce speed, echo impatience of desire [modern tools are machines]

C.content: “things won’t stop computing in me,” Derrida wants to touch the necessity of the contingency of Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins [compare to Lacan’s: can’t stop being-written]
C.linkedContent: “things won’t stop computing in me,” Derrida wants to touch the necessity of the contingency of Titus-Carmel’s 127 coffins [compare to Lacan’s: can’t stop being-written]

TN.content: mechanical technique (esp. machines) as a simulacrum of “sensible”—does not feel itself feel, does not hierarchize the “5 senses”: opens place for metonymic substitution
TN.linkedContent: mechanical technique (esp. machines) as a simulacrum of “sensible”—does not feel itself feel, does not hierarchize the “5 senses”: opens place for metonymic substitution

TN.content: leibhaftig as incarnate? does Leib have flesh? > what about machine-bodies, technical supplements, which are both Körper and Leib [p. 361n Derrida points to his early work on Husserl]
TN.linkedContent: leibhaftig as incarnate? does Leib have flesh? > what about machine-bodies, technical supplements, which are both Körper and Leib [p. 361n Derrida points to his early work on Husserl]

E.content: for Kant, the “as if” of the poet (“as if” of nature) is better, sincerer, more loyal than the “as if” of the orator, who wears a mask, deceives, his “as if” is “machine-like”
E.linkedContent: for Kant, the “as if” of the poet (“as if” of nature) is better, sincerer, more loyal than the “as if” of the orator, who wears a mask, deceives, his “as if” is “machine-like”

E.content: rhetoric often compared to a machine, because there’s no intention inside > false life, empty symbolism of these sophistical tekhnai
E.linkedContent: rhetoric often compared to a machine, because there’s no intention inside > false life, empty symbolism of these sophistical tekhnai

BSi.content: Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity
BSi.linkedContent: Hobbes: “Soveraignty is an Artificiall Soul” > soul as principle of life, vitality, vivacity

BSi.content: state, a robot, an animal monster, giant prosthesis designed to amplify
BSi.linkedContent: state, a robot, an animal monster, giant prosthesis designed to amplify

BSi.content: animal-machine, living-machine, machine of death: serving the living > prosthstate, and yet vitalist in that it mimics the body > civil war [like Schmitt?] death of the State
BSi.linkedContent: animal-machine, living-machine, machine of death: serving the living > prosthstate, and yet vitalist in that it mimics the body > civil war [like Schmitt?] death of the State

BSi.content: free sovereignty over social body & one’s own body (like the king’s 2 bodies) > duel w/ marionette transforms winner into a machine (in playing angel, one plays the beast [Pascal])
BSi.linkedContent: free sovereignty over social body & one’s own body (like the king’s 2 bodies) > duel w/ marionette transforms winner into a machine (in playing angel, one plays the beast [Pascal])

BSi.content: phallus as marionette avant la lettre: simulacrum, prosthetic, automatic machine—is the phallus human at all? > phallic erection is a machine but also the attribute of sovereignty
BSi.linkedContent: phallus as marionette avant la lettre: simulacrum, prosthetic, automatic machine—is the phallus human at all? > phallic erection is a machine but also the attribute of sovereignty

OG.content: (117-18, 117n) Leibniz’s infinitist “logic of God”—logos, a characteristic & ontological argument, infinitist, technicism, leads to parole par la machine
OG.linkedContent: (117-18, 117n) Leibniz’s infinitist “logic of God”—logos, a characteristic & ontological argument, infinitist, technicism, leads to parole par la machine

OG.content: Leroi-Gourhan invokes notion of program, not a recourse to differentiating man from animal but understood in cybernetic sense (only intelligible via possibility of trace): far beyond “intentional consciousness,” makes grammè appear as such > a “liberation of memory” (reading machines, electronic card indexes) that enlarges differance and possibility of putting in reserve: constitutes/effaces conscious subjectivity, its logos, and its theological attributes [baby daddy]

OG.content: writing of voice, une meilleure police (civil order [?]) > also a machine of death
OG.linkedContent: writing of voice, une meilleure police (civil order [?]) > also a machine of death

OG.content: unless there’s an extrinsic desire, Leibniz’s universal characteristic represents death of jouissance, scientific machine, pure state of representer > the telos of scriptural alienation

EU.content: Descartes’ counter-proposal [to Hardy]: arcanum of “true science” > method, artificial intelligence, translating machine (could be taught in very little time): universality as principle of order, as path, passage, odos
